Key Arguments: There is no such thing as misinformation or disinformation; there is only information.
The way to address potentially incorrect information is by providing better or correct information.
Protecting the right of citizens to make up their own minds is essential.
Information is not a threat to safety or well-being, but the proposed legislation is.
Free speech is crucial, and without it, tyranny ensues.
Notable Quotes: There is no such thing as 'misinformation' or 'disinformation'. There is only 'information'.
Information, whether correct or not, is not a threat to the safety or well-being of Australians. But this Bill certainly is.
It's called the sanctity of free speech and without it there can only be tyranny.
